titles.title: When I Survey The Wondrous Cross

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: When I survey the wondrous cross newline On which the Prince of glory died, newline My richest gain I count but loss, newline And pour contempt on all my pride.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Forbid it, Lord, that I should boast, newline Save in the death of Christ, my God; newline All the vain things that charm me most, newline I sacrifice them to His blood.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: See, from His head, His hands, His feet, newline Sorrow and love flow mingled down; newline Did e'er such love and sorrow meet, newline Or thorns compose so rich a crown?

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Were the whole realm of nature mine, newline That were a present far too small; newline Love so amazing, so divine, newline Demands my soul, my life, my all.
